author: cole.vt
title: Sustainable ADA
description: Sustainable ADA will expand outreach and education for explaining use cases/examples of how Cardano can help create a sustainable world.

assessments.note:
good idea, through education and project advertisements, to increase the number of proposers. Definitely can work, but it feels like education is a primary goal, and increase the proposer's outreach is just a side effect, that is why I put 4.

Also:

"- Create informational content, exploring how Cardano can make the world more sustainable or help work towards completing current (SDGs).
- Create a network exploring and promoting current projects running on Cardano, that will help make strides towards a sustainable world.
- Encourage other members from outside the community to come in and implement their sustainable projects on or working with Cardano's blockchain technology."

it is only third goal of this project.

The proposal lists noble goals in the aims like " the focus of tracking and eliminating counterfeit goods in the retail system; help solve healthcare issues with fake medicine and a financial loss. These are just a few examples of direct changes Cardano is making." However, the role of the Cardano ecosystem in achieving these is not clear. Why there goals are selected to attract proposers to Catalyst is also not clear.

The proposal aims at promoting how Cardano could be used to develop sustainable systems, which is undoubtedly an central topic in our current time, and which can have a big impact on convincing people to use Cardano and/or make proposals.

The project has a lot of potential, because it seeks to tune into two areas that are very important and urgent for today's world. The economy is changing, and blockchain is a new way of doing it. Just as sustainability has always been, and now more than ever, an urgent agenda to be addressed. If the link between Cardano and Sustainability was formed, I believe it will be beneficial for everyone, and at the same time it can attract new entrepreneurs and members to our community (thus being in accordance with the objectives of this challenge) and benefiting the planet. I, in particular, do not have much theoretical basis on how Cardano can benefit sustainable projects, that is, it would be interesting to have this subject more studied and clarified for me too, as well as, I imagine, for many people.

hard to tell, whether he can pull it off, but the site works, and the budget is high enough to secure other people or tools to achieve the goal.

Still skeptical. 

Also, what is the final product? A website? If that is so, I believe he can pull it off.
To succeed it requires a plan for delivery of the materials to educators. It is not clear what this plan is or whether the proposer has the experience and connection to deliver on it.

The proposer is a university student. The goal set in the proposal is noble however connection to the requirement of "proposer outreach" is not clearly explained, leaving with the doubt regarding the capability to implement the project sucessfully.

The experience is relevant and on point, but the plan is a bit vague in some places, so it's not super easy to judge it. The proposal itself seems to have big goals, and the budget is not small, but the lack of a timeline and of work experience instills a little doubt whether all of this will actually be realized.

The author shows himself to be a well-qualified person to launch the project, since he has an academic background in Economics, and a specialization in sustainability. In this way, your theoretical knowledge is fully aligned with the project. It is also beneficial that there is a video attached to the proposal, where he introduces himself and talks about the project, the vision, the platform and so on. With that we can get to know him more particularly, and seeing him describing the idea generates a lot of confidence and credibility for the project. Besides the author, other people participated in the video, however, they do not talk about themselves, which would be interesting too, because apparently they are the rest of the people who compose and the team.
I did not find any metrics on how it increases the number of proposers.
For this project to be feasible it needs to be successful in outreach. How this is going to be achieved should be detailed.
The proposal has a well-made presentation and a website. However, no clear plan emerges from the proposal which could be analyzed to evaluate the proposal.

The plan is quite detailed and the budget is partitioned. However, it lacks a timeline and success metrics are not defined, so judging its success, especially given the big goals, might not be an easy task

We have a very detailed division of how financial money would be used, which professionals would be hired, etc. We can also find out what actions would involve the project, in the Sustainable ADA Network part, in which it is explained which components would compose the future platform (which is a website, according to the attached video). In my view, there was only a lack of weather forecast in relation to the project, we could have an expectation of steps to be made according to the months, for example. I believe that only that part was absent, because otherwise everything is well explained, both in the text and in the attached video.

solution: Connecting Cardano to our current SDGs; how it can help create an equal and sustainable world. Creating educational content for all ages!
experience: Senior at the University of New Hampshire. Economics Major, and a dual major in Sustainability. Experienced Sustainability EDU coursework.
